item.title: Callum Cook pleads not guilty to Christmas Day murder of Russell Klein in Millmerran
item.description: A barrister for the accused tells a Queensland court Callum Cook acted in self-defence during an incident that left a 55-year-old father dead in his front yard.

item.title: Labor backbencher calls for action to stop countries onselling Australian gas
item.description: Ed Husic calls for stronger action to prevent foreign countries that buy Australian gas from onselling it to other countries.

item.title: Myanmar's military uses paraglider to bomb festival and anti-junta protest
item.description: People were gathering for the festival and an anti-junta demonstration when bombs killed at least 20 people and injured dozens more.

item.title: Beth Mooney, Alana King save Australia from Women's Cricket World Cup upset loss to Pakistan
item.description: Beth Mooney's century and a classy unbeaten 51 from Alana King saves Australia from a stunning upset loss to Pakistan at the Cricket World Cup.

item.title: Trio of scientists awarded Nobel Prize in Chemistry for 'development of metal-organic frameworks'
item.description: Scientists Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi receive the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry "for the development of metal-organic frameworks", the award-giving body announces.

item.title: Diamonds put foot down to beat South Africa in 67-40 victory
item.description: Australia flew out of the blocks to take a 2-0 lead in the series and extend their unbeaten record against South Africa to an extraordinary 48 wins.

item.title: Former FBI director James Comey pleads not guilty in Congress case
item.description: The guilty plea follows an extraordinary chain of events that saw Mr Trump publicly implore Attorney General Pam Bondi to take action against Mr Comey and other perceived adversaries.

item.title: Manchester synagogue attacker Jihad Al-Shamie pledged allegiance to Islamic State during attack, police say
item.description: British counter terror police say Jihad Al-Shamie called police during his attack on a Manchester synagogue to declare his allegiance to the terror group.

item.title: Can we still trust Australia's sunscreens?
item.description: Summer is just around the corner, and many Australians are confused right now about which sunscreens they can trust.

item.title: Optus wears blame but government needs to explain how it handled early advice
item.description: The government is determined to avoid wearing any blame for Optus' failure but also needs to be transparent about how it handled early advice from the telco.

item.title: Older Australians struggling to find work before hitting the pension age
item.description: In the three years that 65-year-old Kerry Forrest has been applying for positions, she has faced repeated rejection. She thinks it is time employers consider older workers more favourably.

item.title: Antarctic icebreaker's costly refuelling saga yet to be resolved
item.description: Two years after the RSV Nuyina was banned from going under Hobart's Tasman Bridge to refuel, the Australian Antarctic Division has formally ditched the possibility of trying to overturn the decision.

item.title: In voice notes from Gaza, Majeda chronicles her family's displacement and despair
item.description: The war in Gaza may be ending soon, but those displaced by Israel's bombardment and invasion know their suffering is far from over.

item.title: Renewed focus on 'kill cars' as police swarm on hit crew in Sydney's south-west
item.description: It is a tried and true tactic in the underworld when trying to get away with murder, but police have sought out "kill cars" and they are reaping the rewards from it.

item.title: Australia's energy transition in flux amid struggle to build major transmission arteries
item.description: Touted as a model for the energy transition, a "quick and easy" high-voltage powerline project linking South Australia directly to New South Wales is running dramatically over time and over budget.

item.title: University wrongly accuses students of using artificial intelligence to cheat
item.description: An Australian university has accused thousands of its students of cheating with artificial intelligence. The problem? Many have done nothing wrong.

item.title: Third narco sub found in Solomon Islands, as cocaine and meth trafficking comes to the Pacific
item.description: Cousins Reubenson and Martin Fugui found a 'Made in Colombia' narco sub in Solomon Islands over the weekend — the third such vessel found in the country's waters over the past year.

item.title: Expert says AI-generated image of missing four-year-old Gus is concerning but not surprising
item.description: An expert in artificial intelligence says a fake image depicting missing four-year-old Gus being abducted in South Australia's outback highlights the dangerous link between AI and the spread of misinformation.

item.title: Queensland government urged to take stronger action on conservation as number of threatened species rises
item.description: The Queensland Conservation Council (QCC) has called out the LNP government for "not taking the environment seriously" with the number of flora and fauna species under threat on the rise.

item.title: Domain rental report for September quarter shows rent for houses stable across combined capital cities
item.description: Domain's September quarterly report shows house rents across the country's combined capitals have remained stable for five consecutive quarters.

item.title: Powerlifting champion aged 82 and ready to represent Australia
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Man who turned to weightlifting for health now headed to powerlifting world championships at 82
item.description: Ravi Sood turned to the gym to help build muscle before a knee replacement. It has changed his life and led him to the World Masters Powerlifting Championships.

item.title: Police thought alleged Croydon Park gunman was 'fine' in weeks leading up to shooting
item.description: A close family member of Artemios Mintzas tells the ABC she asked police to visit his unit three weeks ago, after growing increasingly concerned about his state of mind.

item.title: Murray Watt nears deal with Coalition to finally overhaul environment laws
item.description: Environment Minister Murray Watt will sit down with his Liberal counterpart Angie Bell today, with quiet optimism in both parties that a deal might soon be struck to finally rewrite Australia's "broken" and outdated environment laws.

item.title: Infant's death in illegal Robinvale childcare centre among sector's secret failures
item.description: The death of a 15-week-old baby in an unlicensed home day care in Victoria’s north-west is among more than two dozen disturbing childcare incidents recorded in government documents unearthed by the ABC.

item.title: Advocates say First Nations children's commissioner must have power to make change
item.description: Governments have been unable to reduce the rates of First Nations children in out-of-care and youth detention. Advocates say the new children's commissioner needs the power to hold them to account.

item.title: Family donates $1.7 million to transform dementia care at aged care facility
item.description: An aged care facility in western Victoria receives an "unprecedented" donation that will allow it to enhance the lives of residents living with dementia.

item.title: Hereditary fructose intolerance group to raise awareness about often-misdiagnosed condition
item.description: A Queensland woman is on a mission to raise awareness about hereditary fructose intolerance, after having to wait until age 45 to understand why so many foods make her sick.

item.title: Endometriosis sufferers battling to manage pain as system struggles to cope
item.description: Women suffering from the chronic pain associated with endometriosis have called for more government investment into understanding the condition, with an expert warning the mental effects can be just as debilitating as the physical symptoms.

item.title: Manhunt underway after man shot dead, cars set alight in Sydney's Riverstone
item.description: In the footage obtained by the ABC, several shots could be heard ringing out as a toddler was seen standing in a driveway metres from where Suman Mokhtarian was killed.

item.title: AFL trade period, day four recap: St Kilda causes a stir by aborting Leek Aleer deal after adding Liam Ryan, Max Heath joins Melbourne
item.description: St Kilda officially adds Liam Ryan in a trade with West Coast as the AFL world continues to react to the Saints' stunning decision to pull out of a move for Leek Aleer. Here's how day four of the AFL trade period panned out.

item.title: Alex de Minaur wins 50th tennis match for 2025, reaching Shanghai Masters clash with Daniil Medvedev
item.description: Alex de Minaur wins 50 matches in a season for the first time in his career as he reaches the quarterfinals at the Shanghai Masters.

item.title: AC Milan star Adrien Rabiot says plan to play Serie A match in Perth is 'truly absurd'
item.description: AC Milan midfielder Adrien Rabiot hits out at plans to play a game in Perth, earning a rebuke from the Serie A chief executive.

item.title: Measles warning issued in WA's Pilbara as confirmed cases rise
item.description: Health authorities say they are not able to trace WA's latest measles cases to a source, meaning they cannot tell how far the virus has spread.

item.title: Beast of War is the indie shark movie that bit off a lot
item.description: Mystery Road star Mark Coles Smith and his Beast of War director Kiah Roache-Turner on taking a chomp out of WWII soldiers.

item.title: Self-taught child drummer makes rock band debut with The Living End
item.description: It was a dream come true when 12-year-old Noah Pope was pulled from the crowd to perform with The Living End.

item.title: Dolly Parton responds to concerns about her health, says she is not dying
item.description: Dolly Parton has taken to social media to hose down speculation about her health after a comment from her sister sent fans into a tailspin.

item.title: Sam Kerr returns to Champions League in Chelsea's draw with Twente Enschede
item.description: Australian striker Sam Kerr makes another appearance for Chelsea off the bench, getting 23 minutes of playing time but unable to break a 1-1 deadlock with their Dutch opponent.

item.title: Argentina-Puerto Rico football friendly moved from Chicago amid immigration crack down
item.description: An Argentine Football Association executive confirms an upcoming football match against Puerto Rico is moving from Chicago due to the National Guard being called in to quell immigration protests.

item.title: Mount Gambier's Urgent Care Clinic to reopen but GP shortage continues
item.description: While a government-funded medical clinic is set to reopen, residents in SA's second biggest city are still struggling to access local care.

item.title: RFS firefighter seriously injured by falling tree at Coutts Crossing
item.description: A volunteer firefighter is hospitalised with head and neck injuries after being hit by a falling tree on a fireground on the NSW north coast.

item.title: Fertiliser plant uncertainty puts Mount Isa Copper Smelter future in doubt despite bailout
item.description: Mining giant Glencore's government bailout was touted as its outback smelter's saving grace, but uncertainty about a fertiliser plant it relies on could still see it cease production before 2028.

item.title: Albany's tiny art gallery joins growing global community
item.description: A new tiny art gallery on WA's south coast adds to a growing global movement of community verge-side offerings that range from puzzles to seed exchange.

item.title: Victorian government defends bail laws as opposition criticises new judicial guidance
item.description: The Victorian government defends the strength of its bail laws, after the opposition criticised a recently updated guide instructing bail decision-makers to release an alleged child offender "whenever possible".

item.title: The draft order to approve Hobart's stadium has been released. So what's in it?
item.description: Tasmania's parliamentarians have received a draft version of the order they'll vote on to determine the fate of the Macquarie Point Stadium project.

item.title: Hit-and-run driver Jake Danby's case sparks outrage in NT communities as victim's family calls for jail time
item.description: A fatal hit-and-run case in Darwin has exposed deep disparities in the NT’s justice system, say Aboriginal leaders, as the victim’s family speaks out.

item.title: Cessnock Rifle Club captain charged with manslaughter after pig hunting incident
item.description: A 63-year-old rifle club captain has been granted bail after being charged with manslaughter over a shooting incident in the NSW Hunter Valley.

item.title: Man charged with careless driving over fatal crash involving CBH grain train near Albany
item.description: The man behind the wheel of a car that collided with a freight train near Albany, killing his female passenger, has been charged with careless driving.

item.title: Pat Cummins's injury recovery continues ahead of Ashes, Mitchell Starc confident he can perform
item.description: Australia captain Pat Cummins is in serious doubt for the Ashes and has almost been ruled out of appearing in the first Test as he continues his recovery from a back injury.

item.title: Bell Bay Aluminium delivers 'unsettling news' to staff ahead of power deal expiry
item.description: Bell Bay Aluminium has told staff the company faces a "significant risk" after negotiations for a new power deal stalled, jeopardising its future.

item.title: How reading romance has helped keep the spark alive for this couple
item.description: After 10 years of marriage and two kids, Joseph Heath and wife Laura are still in the "honeymoon phase". He says romance novels are a large part of why.

item.title: Tony Burke suddenly keen to answer questions about Islamic State relatives
item.description: This week in Canberra, Tony Burke finally answered questions about the return of Islamic State relatives, Senate estimates turned into an episode of Utopia, and Andrew Hastie quit the frontbench.

item.title: Tasmanians urged to prepare for wind gusts of up to 125kph
item.description: Residents on the north and west coast of Tasmania are being warned to secure loose items around their homes ahead of wind gusts of up to 125 kilometres per hour.

item.title: Kangaroo Island visitor details 'extraordinary moment of timing' family came across shark attack
item.description: A man who witnessed the "extraordinary" moment a surfer was bitten by a shark chasing a seal offshore Kangaroo Island has spoken to the ABC after his footage circulated online.

item.title: First look inside the Sydney Fish Market, with opening date yet to be confirmed
item.description: The NSW government is expecting construction for the long-awaited Sydney Fish Market development to be completed by next month, but an opening date for the $700 million project is yet to be announced.

item.title: Israel and Hamas's first-phase peace plan agreement is monumental but the end of the war is far from certain
item.description: The announcement that Israel and Hamas have agreed to phase one of a peace deal in Gaza is significant. But despite the celebrations, the end of the war is still far from certain, writes Matthew Doran.

item.title: Netball fights for recognition amid influx of women's sports
item.description: Netball Australia is taking elite-level netball to regional communities, hoping to showcase the sport's global impact and inspire the next generation of athletes.

item.title: How drought inspired Goondiwindi's thriving art movement
item.description: Goondiwindi's Lanescape art collective transforms the Queensland border town into an open-air gallery featuring large steel sculptures.

item.title: Mixed feelings among Israelis after news of hostage return
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Israelis celebrate deal announcement with US flags and Trump costume
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Mitch Brown was thrust into the spotlight after coming out. He wants to use it to 'call people in,' not out
item.description: After coming out, Mitch Brown became an unofficial spokesperson for queer issues in the AFL. While that experience has been overwhelmingly positive, it's also come with an onslaught of hate.

item.title: Marnus Labuschagne boosts Ashes hopes with One-Day Cup century for Queensland
item.description: Marnus Labuschagne's case for a men's Ashes call-up continues to build after he scored a second century in the space of a week and third of the domestic summer.

item.title: Future of pokies boss hangs in balance after US gaming licence troubles
item.description: An Australian pokie machine giant says it is reviewing its chief executive's future after a US gaming regulator spurned his licence application. It comes months after the ABC revealed he was the subject of a corruption investigation in Austria.

item.title: Competition watchdog approves Elders' $475m acquisition of agribusiness rival Delta
item.description: The consumer watchdog has given the go-ahead for Elders to acquire its competitor, Delta, but it must sell six Delta stores in WA to improve competition.

item.title: NT chief minister ignores requests for chauffeur service rules after pizzeria, golf club trips
item.description: The NT chief minister is ignoring requests for information about rules for a taxpayer-funded VIP chauffeur service after claiming trips to a pizzeria and golf club were above board.

item.title: Melbourne Storm grants Nelson Asofa-Solomona immediate release from NRL contract
item.description: Melbourne will clear Nelson Asofa-Solomona's salary from its cap after the powerful front-rower was granted a release from the final two years of his deal with the club.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Bunbury massage therapist Anthony Brain sex assault trial begins with French nudist colony claims
item.description: Bunbury masseur Anthony Brain told women clients he needed to work on intimate parts of their bodies to relieve tension, but in reality it was for his own pleasure, a Perth court hears as his sexual assault trial gets underway.

item.title: Thursday's Finance news with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Deloitte caught out using AI in report for federal government
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Questions over Optus's priorities during the triple-0 crisis
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Ruby Hunter, Shellie Morris and Missy Higgins among recipients at Australian Women in Music Awards
item.description: The Australian Women in Music Awards recognised contributions across the music sector, from artists, to photographers, journalists, filmmakers, and leaders.

item.title: China further limits the export of rare earth materials and products
item.description: The issue has been a key sticking point in the trade war between Beijing and Washington.

item.title: Jail term increased for man who appealed Gisele Pelicot rape conviction
item.description: Husamettin Dogan, 44, was the only one to have maintained his appeal after the first trial last year of 51 men, including Gisele Pelicot's husband, in the case of mass sexual abuse that shocked France and the world.

item.title: Google is abruptly changing the game for journalism — again
item.description: The launch of 'AI Mode' ushers in a future where news sites are kept alive to train AI chatbots for a US tech company.

item.title: Developer requests review after Tasmanian council knocks back 263-home Evandale project
item.description: Rural residents in Tasmania's north hope a recent council decision will spell the end for a developer wanting to build almost 300 homes.

item.title: Gaza updates: US sending 200 troops to Israel to help monitor peace deal — as it happened
item.description: The Israeli cabinet has approved a framework for the release of hostages, according to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Vladimir Putin is fearful the return of his convict army could destabilise Russian society, sources say
item.description: The Russian president views the prospect of an army returning en masse as a potential risk he wants carefully managed to avoid destabilising society, three sources close to the Kremlin said.

item.title: First Guardian super trustee Diversa 'ticked off' investments, says former financial adviser Ferras Merhi
item.description: A former financial adviser involved in placing thousands of clients into the First Guardian Master Fund says he was given clearance by superannuation trustee Diversa to do so after the trustee initially flagged compliance concerns.

item.title: Ceasefire announcement met with joy and some scepticism in Israel and Gaza
item.description: The announcement of an agreement to phase one of a ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas brings great joy to many people in Israel and Gaza.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Trump says hostages to be released early next week
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Paul Brereton 'consulted' for ADF watchdog 11 times while head of NACC, Senate estimates hears
item.description: Paul Brereton and Labor politicians had previously stated he had stepped away from the body and resigned as assistant inspector-general of the ADF prior to taking on the top integrity job.

item.title: Sick sea turtle rescued from algal bloom recovering at Adelaide Zoo
item.description: A walker says Adelaide Zoo's care for an injured sea turtle he rescued from Moana beach is a small sign of hope amid the destruction of South Australia's algal bloom.

item.title: Will the Liberals hold firm in the fight over freedom of information?
item.description: Crossbenchers are joining forces to condemn the government's FOI bill, calling for its withdrawal and an independent inquiry. Will the Coalition stand for transparency?

item.title: The US sees Pacific Islands as 'tip of the spear', but locals fear becoming China's 'bullseye'
item.description: The United States is spending billions of dollars muscling up across its Pacific Island military outposts, but locals fear their peaceful islands will become a target.

item.title: Coal-fired power stations to operate in Queensland until least 2046 as energy road map unveiled
item.description: The five-year plan lays out what role coal, gas, wind, solar, pumped hydro and battery storage will play over the long-term in Queensland.

item.title: Beyond Blue survey finds loneliness has deeper impact on some Australians' mental health than financial hardship
item.description: A new national report by Beyond Blue has revealed loneliness and social isolation has reached new heights, with 46 per cent of respondents listing it as a bigger mental health stressor than financial hardship.

item.title: Why Alliyah is identifying themselves as a victim-survivor — and the power this act holds
item.description: Alliyah's decision to talk about their abuse was a brave act that exposed the red flags that weren't caught along the way — and they hope it helps others.

item.title: Inside the NSW government chat group as the Sydney Harbour Bridge pro-Palestinian march unfolded
item.description: Documents obtained by the ABC reveal internal discussions within the NSW government did not align with the external NSW Police messaging that the march could have been "catastrophic".

item.title: Advocates mixed on plans to bolster undercover police powers to share child abuse material
item.description: The spread of child abuse material in Australia has come under renewed focus following high-profile incidents of childcare workers abusing toddlers, and a push by the Coalition to introduce mandatory minimum prison sentences for child exploitation offences.

item.title: Global pilot shortage could mean more delays after push to raise retirement age
item.description: A bid to raise the retirement age for pilots has been grounded, with some experts warning the decision could worsen flight delays, cause cancellations and increase airfares.

item.title: London is the world's 'phone theft capital', but one Aussie decides to fight back
item.description: Emma Van Der Hoek had only just moved to London from Sydney when her phone was stolen. She was inspired to do something about it.

item.title: Man returns to boxing after sepsis forces partial amputations of his arms and legs
item.description: Adam Smith became "fixated" on returning to the gym after sepsis forced the partial amputation of his arms and legs. Now he can press 365 kilograms and get back into boxing.

item.title: Boy, 16, among three alleged 'contract criminals' charged in Sydney 'kill car' blitz
item.description: Strike Force Flodine is investigating a network of alleged "contract criminals" hired by organised crime groups, and their use of staged vehicles or "kill cars" in Sydney.

item.title: South Africa defeat India by three wickets in Women's Cricket World Cup at Visakhapatnam
item.description: South Africa defeats co-hosts India by three wickets in the group stage of the Women's Cricket World Cup.

item.title: New statistics show Victoria's most dangerous roads are in regional areas
item.description: In regional Victoria, potholes are not being fixed and major rural road projects have stalled, despite the loss of life from accidents.

item.title: 'Sigh of relief': Israelis react to first phase of Gaza peace deal
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Israelis gather at Hostage Square in Tel Aviv to celebrate peace deal
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The NT's first Alice Springs-based police commissioner has a rocky road ahead
item.description: Martin Dole has been a Northern Territory police officer for nearly 30 years — but as the new commissioner, his most challenging role now lies ahead.

item.title: Two dead on private property in Tasmania after tree falls in wild winds
item.description: Two people have died after a tree fell on them on a rural property in Tasmania's north-west, during Friday's severe winds and wet weather, police say.

item.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock fronts Senate hearing, ASX ends the week lower — As it happened
item.description: Michele Bullock says either shoppers or merchants will have to pay more under the central bank's proposed debit and credit card changes. The ASX closed lower after oil and gold prices retreated.

item.title: Rain causes crashes during first Bathurst 1000 practice sessions on Mount Panorama
item.description: Supercars heavyweights Triple Eight lead the charge into the Bathurst 1000 with one eye on the trophy and another on the weather forecast.

item.title: What the State of WA’s appeal of Dion Barber’s $2.8 million compensation win could mean for abuse survivors
item.description: Less than a decade after the door opened for victims of historic child sexual abuse to seek justice in WA, abuse survivors could be at risk of having that door shut again, writes Cason Ho.

item.title: Hamas is trusting Trump as his 'eternal peace' in Gaza turns into a shaky ceasefire
item.description: With Israel and Hamas not sticking to Donald Trump's proposed "20-point plan", the deal to bring "eternal peace" in the Middle East looks more like a temporary ceasefire.

item.title: AFL trade period, day five recap: Geelong opens Charlie Curnow bidding as Sydney looms, Ben Ainsworth and Campbell Chesser join Blues
item.description: The chase for Carlton star Charlie Curnow heated up on day five of the AFL trade period, with Geelong seeing an offer rejected as Sydney prepared its bid.

item.title: Novak Djokovic advances to Shanghai Masters semifinals, qualifier Valentin Vacherot continues fairytale run
item.description: Fourth seed Novak Djokovic battled past a spirited Zizou Bergs 6-3 7-5 on Thursday to reach the Shanghai Masters semifinals for a 10th time, setting up a clash with surprise package and world number 204 Valentin Vacherot.

item.title: Indonesia urges respect for its sovereignty after Australia-PNG defence treaty
item.description: The landmark agreement commits both countries to "meet the common danger" in the event of an armed attack on either. With that, questions have been raised about Australia's role if the conflict in West Papua escalates.

item.title: Israeli government approves phase one of Gaza ceasefire and hostage deal
item.description: The Israeli government has approved Gaza's ceasefire and hostage deal, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said early on Friday.

item.title: Australia's dark matter experiment construction nears completion
item.description: Deep underground in an old gold mine in regional Victoria, scientists enter a worldwide race to understand the composition of dark matter.

item.title: Netanyahu and US envoys address media after Cabinet meeting
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Industrial businesses to ramp-up noise monitoring over humming noise in Sydney's north-west
item.description: The NSW environmental watchdog has acted on complaints by residents in Sydney's north-west who have been kept awake at night by a disturbing humming noise.

item.title: Several Australian Gaza flotilla activists home after being detained by Israel
item.description: Australians who were on the Global Sumud Flotilla, a fleet of ships intercepted by Israel's navy off Gaza last week, are met by supporters upon their arrival.

item.title: Principals' power to ban aggressive parents from school grounds to extend to social media behaviour
item.description: Principals in Victoria already have the power to ban aggressive or violent parents from school grounds, but the state government is looking to apply the power to parents' behaviour on social media.

item.title: Former ACT attorney-general Gordon Ramsay suspended as CEO of Cultural Facilities Corporation
item.description: Former ACT attorney-general Gordon Ramsay has been suspended without pay from his role as CEO of the Cultural Facilities Corporation while he faces charges for grooming a teenager.

item.title: Federal government investigates PFAS spread in Rockhampton amid concern for property prices
item.description: Christine Stasch was planning to sell her family farm and retire further north. Now, she is fighting for compensation after discovering PFAS contamination on her property.

item.title: Hollywood icon Paul Feig to take audiences behind-the-scenes of Bridesmaids at SXSW Sydney
item.description: Hollywood director Paul Feig has a special strategy that's served him well when it comes to making popular movies and television shows that stand the test of time.

item.title: Synergy apologises after overcharging customers $40 million
item.description: More than 170,000 customers have been overcharged a total of $40 million by WA's state-owned energy retailer Synergy since 2009, sparking an apology from its CEO.

item.title: Public health alert for nitazenes issued after person dies in Queensland
item.description: Queensland Health issues a public health alert warning nitazenes have been detected in tablets.

item.title: Cairns faces prospect of water restrictions at wettest time of year
item.description: Cairns residents are urged to cut down on their water use as multiple infrastructure failures put the city at risk of water shortfalls heading into summer.

item.title: Police interview woman after man's death in Broome
item.description: A 41-year-old man dies after an altercation with a woman in Western Australia's north.

item.title: PM says there's 'nothing unusual' in Treasury meeting on contentious superannuation tax proposal
item.description: Anthony Albanese says his request for Treasury to examine a controversial proposal to lift taxes on some superannuation balances is "nothing unusual", rejecting claims he is planning to rewrite it.

item.title: Matildas confirm return of Sam Kerr to squad for England and Wales friendlies
item.description: Sam Kerr is back in the Matildas squad for the first time since late 2023, ahead of friendlies against Wales and England.

item.title: Judge dismisses Drake's lawsuit over Kendrick Lamar diss track Not Like Us
item.description: The judge says a reasonable listener could not have concluded that Not Like Us was conveying objective facts about Drake.

item.title: Working dog makes championship comeback after leg amputation
item.description: Cheese was on track to be a champion when an accident cut his working dog trial career short. A year on from a leg amputation, the border collie is back in the yards and the winner's circle.

item.title: Two dead after magnitude-7.4 Philippines earthquake sparks tsunami warnings
item.description: The quake hit in the Mindanao region at a depth of 62 kilometres below ground level and could cause hazardous tsunami waves along coasts within 300km of the epicentre, seismology authorities say.

item.title: RBA governor Michele Bullock says First Home Guarantee could lead to riskier loans
item.description: RBA Governor Michele Bullock says the federal government's First Home Guarantee scheme could see some Australians taking out riskier loans.

item.title: David Pocock reinvited to parliament sports club after prime minister weighs in
item.description: The former star Wallabies player turned independent senator was kicked out of the social sports club after raising concerns about its links to the gambling industry.

item.title: Vladimir Putin says Russian air defences were to blame for Azerbaijani jetliner crash
item.description: The Russian president makes his first public admission of responsibility for the crash, in an effort to improve relations with Azerbaijan.

item.title: Australia 'still optimistic' Pat Cummins will play first Ashes Test against England
item.description: With the opening men's Ashes Test six weeks away, Australia coach Andrew McDonald is not willing to rule out Pat Cummins taking the field in Perth.

item.title: Patients may not see benefits of $8.5 billlion bulk-billing boost for four years
item.description: Patients may not see the benefits of higher bulk-billing for years, and average-out-of-pocket costs are expected to rise, the health department has conceded — despite $8.5 billion being tipped into the GP subsidy scheme from November.

item.title: Sydney rock oysters to be grown at Lakes Entrance on the Gippsland Lakes
